title: The Dylan Amsterdam awarded Netherlands' Leading Hotel at World Travel Awards
text:
The Dylan Amsterdam awarded Netherlands' Leading Hotel at World Travel Awards The Dylan Amsterdam awarded Netherlands' Leading Hotel at World Travel Awards Details Category: Awards   11:45 The Dylan Amsterdam has won Netherlands’ Leading Hotel at the esteemed 2015 World Travel Awards (which took place on the 5th September at Forte Village Resort, Sardina). Recognised and voted for by travel and tourism professionals worldwide this accolade recognises the hotel’s ongoing commitment to excellence, service and luxury. 
A member of the Small Leading Hotels of the World, The Dylan is tucked away in an exceptional 17th-century landmark that onced housed the first theatre in The Netherlands. Overlooking the Keizersgracht, one of Amsterdam’s most famous canals, The Dylan is the city’s most elegant and intimate hotel, renowned for its chic design which reflects its location in the heart of Amsterdam. It prides itself on its meticulous attention to detail, personalised customer service and excellence in the luxury industry. Commenting on being recognised as the leading hotel in The Netherlands, The Dylan Amsterdam’s General Manager, René Bornmann said, “we are delighted to have been awarded such a prestigious accolade especially given the stiff competition from a number of leading hotels. I’m extremely proud of my team and it ‘s down to their consistent efforts to go beyond the call of duty to deliver excellent service to our guests and remain at the top.” The Dylan Amsterdam offers guests an unrivalled location within the city; it is the ideal base from which to explore the local area as well as the famous wonders of Amsterdam itself. It is also a haven for foodie lovers as guests can sample Chef Dennis Kuipers Michelin Star cuisine at the hotel’s restaurant, Vinkeles. An example of the innovative service the hotel offers can be seen in Chef Dennis Kuipers Vinkeles on the Water – Michelin Star dining on board a traditional Muse whilst exploring Amsterdam via the famous canals. The hotel’s Concierge is renowned for its in depth knowledge of the city and “in-the-know” suggestions enabling guests to explore many of Amsterdam’s hidden gems. The Dylan Amsterdam is also famous for its unique offerings that are created for its guests which include, business travellers, foodies, honeymooners, weekenders and of course its many returning customers. Stay at The Dylan Amsterdam from £385 per room, per night including tax. Room price is exclusive breakfast and exclusive 5.5% city tax. Related articles
